Gregory I refers to rustici in Sardinia (ep. 4.26, cf. 5.38; rustici worshipped Apollo at an out-of-the-way place: dial, 2.8.10) and a group living there with the uninviting name Barbaracini (ep. 4.25, 27) as being pagani, together with slaves owned by Jews (ep. 6.30, 9.104) and some of those ruled over by queen Brunhild (ep. 11.49). Gentiles were to be found among the Lombard and Romans populations in Narnia (ep. 2.4) and, apparently, Lombards in Luni (ep. 9.102); elsewhere Gregory regards a Vandal and some Lombards as gentiles: dial. 3.1.3; see too 3.37.2.
